Text.text: SAP Fiori elements comes with two root views:
- sap.fe.core.rootView.Fcl using the flexible column layout
If neither of these root views meet your needs, you can implement and register your own root view.
To define your own root view, proceed as follows:
- Ensure your root view contains a sap.m.NavContainer (or a sap.f.FlexibleColumnLayout).
- Ensure your root view uses the sap.fe.core.rootView.NavContainer controller (or sap.fe.core.rootView.Fcl controller), or a controller extending it.
- Ensure the ID of the NavContainer (or FlexibleColumnLayout) is set as 'appContent' or is defined in the application manifest under /sap.ui5/routing/config/controlId.
- Ensure your root is defined in the application manifest under /sap.ui5/rootView/viewName.
